learning_outcomes.description: Explain the economic importance of the major groups of insects
Describe the characters that define the orders and suborders of insects and be able to recognise and classify insects
Demonstrate how to collect and preserve insects
Produce a report on a topical issue that encompasses the impacts of insects on humans
Describe why insects are so successful as a group of organisms

assessments.task_description: The purpose of the first assignment of this course is to allow you to explore insect behavior and adaptations and present in form of a report
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of the text through Turnitin on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students take SEM images of selected insect structures, write a report and post images to a shared padlet site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of the text through Turnitin on Blackboard. Post on padlet.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Practical/ Demonstration, Presentation, Project
assessments.task_description: Collecting insects provides valuable insight into their habitat, distribution, biology and behaviour and makes their identification easier and more meaningful. Students are encouraged therefore to study insects in the field and are expected to do their own collecting and identifications. Unfortunately, this involves killing insects; however, students are instructed how to do this in the most humane way possible.
assessments.submission_guidelines:
The Assessment submission procedure is as follows:
1. You will be sent the cover sheet for your assignment by e-mail approximately 2 weeks before it is due.
2. You must submit your assignment, with the coversheet attached to the front, through the assignment slot at the SIB Help Desk (Room 229, Goddard Building) by 4.00pm on the above date/dates.
3. You will then receive a receipt. Please retain this receipt as proof of submission. If assessment submission is disputed, you MUST produce this receipt.
4. Please ensure that you keep an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The exam will cover all of the course content.
Format: single word, short paragraph, line drawing answers, definitions, etc. (no long essay-type questions)
assessments.submission_guidelines: You will need to download the question paper included within the Blackboard Test. Once you have completed the exam, upload the completed exam answers file to the Turnitin assignment submission link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
